sentences.en: a member of the President's favoured circle of advisers
sentences.cn: 总统宠爱的顾问班子中的一员

sentences.en: China’s most-favored-nation trading status with the US
sentences.cn: 美国给予中国的最惠国贸易地位

sentences.en: Her name has been mentioned as a favoured leadership candidate.
sentences.cn: 提到她的名字时，说她是领导职位的热门候选人。

sentences.en: Mickey favoured tight skirts with a hemline at the knee.
sentences.cn: 米基喜欢长度及膝的紧身短裙。

sentences.en: Pretty things were said by each in praise of the favoured trees.
sentences.cn: 每人都为赞扬自己喜爱的树木说了一些动听的褒奖之词.

sentences.en: Some political criminals were favoured with amnesty.
sentences.cn: 有几个政治犯受到特赦.

sentences.en: Textile workers favoured protection because they feared an influx of cheap cloth.
sentences.cn: 纺织工人拥护贸易保护措施,因为他们担心涌入廉价纺织品.
纺织工人拥护贸易保护措施.

sentences.en: The December weather favoured our voyage.
sentences.cn: 12月的天气使我们的航行顺利.

sentences.en: The favoured candidate will probably emerge after private discussions.
sentences.cn: 中意的候选人很可能将在私下讨论后产生。

sentences.en: The king also made gifts of land to favoured officials and courtiers.
sentences.cn: 国王还将土地赠给他所宠信的大臣和官员.
天气使我们的航行顺利.

sentences.en: The wind favoured their sailing at dawn.
sentences.cn: 这风便于他们在黎明时航行.

sentences.en: The young girl is favoured by fortune.
sentences.cn: 这年轻的姑娘是个幸运儿.

sentences.en: Today's favoured launching techniques are the airplane tow and the automobile tow.
sentences.cn: 现在常用的起飞方法是用飞机牵引和汽车牵引.

words.tran_cn: 喜爱的；受优惠的；有特权的

trans.tran_en: receiving special attention, help, or treatment, sometimes in an unfair way
